intro: Macaranga saccifera, commonly known as the bladder leaf or Indian rubber plant, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its latex sap is milky and can be used in traditional medicine. The leaves are also used in the production of natural rubber, contributing to its historical significance in the rubber industry.
